name: Lisa
description:
'''Lalisa Manobal'''{{efn|Lisa spells her surname ''Manobal'' in the Latin alphabet. However, ''Manoban'' is a better approximation of the Thai pronunciation and is the spelling recommended by the [[Royal Thai General System of Transcription]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Title of single by Blackpink's Lisa is her real name|url=https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/2021/08/26/entertainment/kpop/lisa-blackpink-lalisa-manobal/20210826112900544.html|author=Yim Seung-hye|website=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]]|date=August 26, 2021|access-date=September 10, 2021|archive-date=September 10, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210910114715/https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/2021/08/26/entertainment/kpop/lisa-blackpink-lalisa-manobal/20210826112900544.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Blackpink Lisa Deceiving Other Members with Her Real Name???|url=https://mnews.joins.com/article/22677888?IgnoreUserAgent=y#home|author=Ryu Jae-yeon|website=[[JoongAng Ilbo]]|date=July 1, 2018|access-date=March 17, 2021|archive-date=May 26, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210526081742/https://mnews.joins.com/article/22677888?IgnoreUserAgent=y#home|url-status=dead}}</ref>}} ({{langx|th|ลลิษา มโนบาล}};{{efn|{{IPA|th|lá.lí.sǎː má.nōː.bāːn|small=no}}}} born '''Pranpriya Manobal''',{{efn|{{langx|th|ปราณปรียา มโนบาล}}. {{RTGS|Pranpriya Manoban|small=no}}. {{IPA|th|prāːn.prīː.jāː má.nōː.bāːn|small=no}}.}} March 27, 1997), known [[mononym]]ously as '''Lisa''' ({{langx|th|ลิซ่า}}; {{korean|리사}}), is a Thai rapper, singer, dancer, songwriter, and actress. She rose to prominence as a member of the South Korean girl group [[Blackpink]], which debuted under [[YG Entertainment]] in August 2016 and became one of the [[List of best-selling girl groups|best-selling girl groups of all time]].

In September 2021, Lisa released her debut single album ''[[Lalisa (single album)|Lalisa]]'', which made her the first female artist to sell 736,000 copies of an album in its first week in South Korea. The music video for its [[Lalisa (song)|lead single]] is the most-viewed music video in the first 24 hours on [[YouTube]] by a solo artist, while the album's viral second single "[[Money (Lisa song)|Money]]" became the first song by a [[K-pop]] solo artist to reach one billion streams on [[Spotify]]; both songs charted in the top ten of the [[Billboard Global 200|''Billboard'' Global 200]]. In 2024, Lisa established her own management company named Lloud, signed with [[RCA Records]], and achieved her first number-one single on the [[Billboard Global Excl. US|''Billboard'' Global Excl. US]] with "[[Rockstar (Lisa song)|Rockstar]]", the lead single of her debut studio album ''[[Alter Ego (Lisa album)|Alter Ego]]'' (2025). The album debuted in the top ten of the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and spawned two number-one songs on the [[Official Thailand Chart]], "[[Born Again (Lisa song)|Born Again]]" and "[[Dream (Lisa song)|Dream]]".

Outside of music, Lisa made her acting debut in 2025 in the [[HBO]] television series ''[[The White Lotus]]''. Her [[List of awards and nominations received by Lisa|accolades]] include nine [[Guinness World Records]], a [[Gaon Chart Music Award]], a [[Mnet Asian Music Award]], three [[MTV Europe Music Awards]], and three [[MTV Video Music Awards]]; she became the first K-pop soloist to win at the latter two award ceremonies. Lisa was honored as a cultural ambassador leader by Thailand's [[Ministry of Culture (Thailand)|Ministry of Culture]] and was acknowledged by Prime Minister [[Prayut Chan-o-cha]] for her contributions to spreading Thai culture globally. She is the [[List of most-followed Instagram accounts|most-followed K-pop artist on Instagram]] and has been recognized for her role in fashion as a global ambassador for [[Celine (brand)|Celine]], [[Bulgari]], [[Louis Vuitton]] and [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]].
